intro: Souroubea stichadenia, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is toxic and can cause skin irritation. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in tropical and subtropical regions.
